segment.source: 4614(S) A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.
segment.target: 4614(S) A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4614(S) A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.
segment.target: Describes security event 4614(S) A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.

segment.source: 4614(S): A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.
segment.target: 4614(S): A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates every time a Notification Package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.
segment.target: This event generates every time a Notification Package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.

segment.source: In reality, starting with Windows Vista, a notification package should be interpreted as afs Password Filter.
segment.target: In reality, starting with Windows Vista, a notification package should be interpreted as afs Password Filter.

segment.source: Password Filters are DLLs that are loaded or called when passwords are set or changed.
segment.target: Password Filters are DLLs that are loaded or called when passwords are set or changed.

segment.source: Each time a system starts, it loads the notification package DLLs from HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlLsaNotification Packages registry value and performs the initialization sequence for every package.
segment.target: Each time a system starts, it loads the notification package DLLs from HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlLsaNotification Packages registry value and performs the initialization sequence for every package.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Notification Package Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of loaded Notification Package.
segment.target: Notification Package Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of loaded Notification Package.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4614(S): A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.
segment.target: For 4614(S): A notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager.

segment.source: Typically this event has an informational purpose.
segment.target: Typically this event has an informational purpose.

segment.source: If you defined the list of allowed Notification Packages in the system, then you can check is “Notification Package Name” field value in the whitelist or not.
segment.target: If you defined the list of allowed Notification Packages in the system, then you can check is “Notification Package Name” field value in the whitelist or not.
